title: 106_s3230
content: Section 1 amends the Commodity Distribution Reform Act regarding the payment of costs for removing risky commodities. Section 2 addresses cost-of-living allowances for uniformed services and a demonstration project under the Child Nutrition Act. Section 3 pertains to the Child and Adult Care Food Program. SEC. 3. CHILD AND ADULT CARE FOOD PROGRAM is amended under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to update technical amendments. Section 17(d)(5)(D) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include exceptions to hearing requirements for institutions that knowingly submit false or fraudulent claims for reimbursement. The State agency may suspend an institution's participation in the program for a fraudulent reimbursement claim. Prior to suspension, an independent review must be conducted. An independent and impartial official conducts a review before suspending an institution for a fraudulent reimbursement claim. The State agency and the institution have the right to submit written documentation related to the suspension. The institution's response to a reimbursement claim is reviewed by an official to determine if it was knowingly false or fraudulent. The institution must suspend payments for up to 120 days upon notification of a suspension, but must continue payments to compliant centers and day care homes. State agencies must provide institutions suspended from the program an opportunity for a fair hearing. Additionally, statewide demonstration projects involving private for-profit organizations providing nonresidential day care services must now focus on all low-income families. State agencies must provide fair hearings for suspended institutions. Statewide demonstration projects must now focus on all low-income families. Amendments include reporting for fiscal year 1998.
